text: Genesis Breyer P-Orridge (born Neil Andrew Megson; 22 February 1950 â€“ 14 March 2020) was an English singer-songwriter, musician, poet, performance artist, and occultist. P-Orridge was known as the founder of the COUM Transmissions artistic collective and frontman of seminal industrial band, Throbbing Gristle. They were also a founding member of Thee Temple ov Psychick Youth occult group, and fronted the experimental band Psychic TV. P-Orridge identifies as third gender. In October 2017, P-Orridge was diagnosed with a rare form of leukaemia. They died from the disease on 14 March 2020 in New York City, aged 70.Genesis Breyer P-Orridge Dead at 70 ==Notes== ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:English singer-songwriters Category:English poets Category:British violinists Category:English guitarists Category:English artists Category:English LGBT people Category:LGBT musicians Category:LGBT singers Category:LGBT songwriters Category:LGBT poets Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:Musicians from Manchester
title: Genesis P-Orridge
